comment.body: Can this code be deleted rather than just commented out?

pull_request.title: Moved OQS KEX definitions to the crypto layer
pull_request.body:
Moved OQS KEX definitions from the ssl layer to the crypto layer. OpenSSL's internal NIDs are now automatically generated through the build system (defined in `crypto/objects/objects.txt` and generate by `make generate_crypto_objects`) and are distinct from the TLS curve/group IDs (still defined by our own code in the ssl layer, because we define special code points for these "curves").

These changes should allow 3rd party applications (such as OpenVPN) to use the oqs algs when looking them up by NID.
`
This is a draft request:
- Some new code needs to be integrated with templating framework

repo.name: openssl
repo.description: Fork of OpenSSL that includes quantum-resistant algorithms and ciphersuites based on liboqs.

repo.name: openssl

comment.body: Why do we still have these jobs in this repo? I thought we were moving all the OpenSSL integration tests out of the testing repo.

pull_request.title: New Docker images
pull_request.body: As per the discussion regarding Docker images this is a 'clean' PR only comprising only Alpine, Centos7&8, Ubuntu-18 image-build instructions in line with what is discussed [here](https://github.com/baentsch/testing/wiki/Docker-image-goals) and may be easier to merge in. As such this may supersede the other PR's in this repo. Let's agree on Wed, Jan 15 (what to keep and what to prune in this repo). This code also is the base for [this PR](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/pull/581) in `liboqs`.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,62 @@
+"""
+Open Quantum Safe (OQS) Python Wrapper for liboqs
+
+The liboqs project provides post-quantum public key cryptography algorithms:
+https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs
+
+This module provides a Python 3 interface to libOQS <oqs/rand.h> RNGs.
+"""
+
+import oqs
+
+
+def randombytes(bytes_to_read):
+    """
+    Generates random bytes. This implementation uses either the default RNG algorithm ("system"), or whichever
+    algorithm has been selected by random_bytes_switch_algorithm().
+
+    :param bytes_to_read: the number of random bytes to generate.
+    :return: random bytes.
+    """
+    result = oqs.ct.create_string_buffer(bytes_to_read)
+    oqs.liboqs.OQS_randombytes(result, oqs.ct.c_int(bytes_to_read))
+    return bytes(result)
+
+
+def randombytes_switch_algorithm(alg_name):
+    """
+    Switches the core OQS_randombytes to use the specified algorithm. See <oqs/rand.h> liboqs headers for more details.
+
+    :param alg_name: algorithm name, possible values are "system", "NIST-KAT", "OpenSSL".
+    """
+    if oqs.liboqs.OQS_randombytes_switch_algorithm(oqs.ct.create_string_buffer(alg_name.encode())) != oqs.OQS_SUCCESS:
+        raise RuntimeError('Can not switch algorithm')
+
+
+def randombytes_nist_kat_init(entropy_input, personalization_string=None):
+    """
+    Initializes the NIST DRBG with the an entropy seed.
+
+    :param entropy_input: entropy input seed, must be exactly 48 bytes long.
+    :param personalization_string: optional personalization string, which, if present, must be at least 48 bytes long.
+    """
+    if len(entropy_input) != 48:
+        raise ValueError('The entropy source must be exactly 48 bytes long')
+
+    if personalization_string is not None:
+        if len(personalization_string) < 48:
+            raise ValueError('The personalization string must be either empty or at least 48 bytes long')
+        oqs.liboqs.OQS_randombytes_nist_kat_init(oqs.ct.create_string_buffer(entropy_input),
+                                                 oqs.ct.create_string_buffer(personalization_string), 256)
+
+    oqs.liboqs.OQS_randombytes_nist_kat_init(oqs.ct.create_string_buffer(entropy_input), 0, 256)
+
+
+# TODO implement it
+def randombytes_in_place(random_array, bytes_to_read):

@@ -0,0 +1,62 @@
+"""
+Open Quantum Safe (OQS) Python Wrapper for liboqs
+
+The liboqs project provides post-quantum public key cryptography algorithms:
+https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs
+
+This module provides a Python 3 interface to libOQS <oqs/rand.h> RNGs.
+"""
+
+import oqs
+
+
+def randombytes(bytes_to_read):
+    """
+    Generates random bytes. This implementation uses either the default RNG algorithm ("system"), or whichever
+    algorithm has been selected by random_bytes_switch_algorithm().
+
+    :param bytes_to_read: the number of random bytes to generate.
+    :return: random bytes.
+    """
+    result = oqs.ct.create_string_buffer(bytes_to_read)
+    oqs.liboqs.OQS_randombytes(result, oqs.ct.c_int(bytes_to_read))
+    return bytes(result)
+
+
+def randombytes_switch_algorithm(alg_name):
+    """
+    Switches the core OQS_randombytes to use the specified algorithm. See <oqs/rand.h> liboqs headers for more details.
+
+    :param alg_name: algorithm name, possible values are "system", "NIST-KAT", "OpenSSL".
+    """
+    if oqs.liboqs.OQS_randombytes_switch_algorithm(oqs.ct.create_string_buffer(alg_name.encode())) != oqs.OQS_SUCCESS:
+        raise RuntimeError('Can not switch algorithm')
+
+
+def randombytes_nist_kat_init(entropy_input, personalization_string=None):
+    """
+    Initializes the NIST DRBG with the an entropy seed.
+
+    :param entropy_input: entropy input seed, must be exactly 48 bytes long.
+    :param personalization_string: optional personalization string, which, if present, must be at least 48 bytes long.
+    """
+    if len(entropy_input) != 48:
+        raise ValueError('The entropy source must be exactly 48 bytes long')
+
+    if personalization_string is not None:
+        if len(personalization_string) < 48:
+            raise ValueError('The personalization string must be either empty or at least 48 bytes long')
+        oqs.liboqs.OQS_randombytes_nist_kat_init(oqs.ct.create_string_buffer(entropy_input),
+                                                 oqs.ct.create_string_buffer(personalization_string), 256)
+
+    oqs.liboqs.OQS_randombytes_nist_kat_init(oqs.ct.create_string_buffer(entropy_input), 0, 256)
+
+
+# TODO implement it
+def randombytes_in_place(random_array, bytes_to_read):
+    raise NotImplementedError
+
+
+# TODO implement it
+def randombytes_custom_algorithm(fun):
comment.body: If I understand, the purpose of this would be to allow a Python caller to replace the liboqs randombytes function with a provided Python function?  If so, I think we can skip that for now and remove this.

comment.body: Well, I'd consider it prudent to have some testing for the build images before they "hit the road". That of course can be done outside CI -- but I already have seen Docker images fail in a CI image that have been build (and tested) outside of it -- admittedly those were all images _containing_ libobs... So, I'm fine removing these here.

pull_request.title: New Docker images
pull_request.body: As per the discussion regarding Docker images this is a 'clean' PR only comprising only Alpine, Centos7&8, Ubuntu-18 image-build instructions in line with what is discussed [here](https://github.com/baentsch/testing/wiki/Docker-image-goals) and may be easier to merge in. As such this may supersede the other PR's in this repo. Let's agree on Wed, Jan 15 (what to keep and what to prune in this repo). This code also is the base for [this PR](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/pull/581) in `liboqs`.

@@ -0,0 +1,62 @@
+"""
+Open Quantum Safe (OQS) Python Wrapper for liboqs
+
+The liboqs project provides post-quantum public key cryptography algorithms:
+https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs
+
+This module provides a Python 3 interface to libOQS <oqs/rand.h> RNGs.
+"""
+

+
+
+def randombytes(bytes_to_read):
+    """
+    Generates random bytes. This implementation uses either the default RNG algorithm ("system"), or whichever
+    algorithm has been selected by random_bytes_switch_algorithm().
+
+    :param bytes_to_read: the number of random bytes to generate.
+    :return: random bytes.
+    """
+    result = oqs.ct.create_string_buffer(bytes_to_read)
+    oqs.liboqs.OQS_randombytes(result, oqs.ct.c_int(bytes_to_read))
+    return bytes(result)
+
+
+def randombytes_switch_algorithm(alg_name):
+    """
+    Switches the core OQS_randombytes to use the specified algorithm. See <oqs/rand.h> liboqs headers for more details.
+
+    :param alg_name: algorithm name, possible values are "system", "NIST-KAT", "OpenSSL".
+    """
+    if oqs.liboqs.OQS_randombytes_switch_algorithm(oqs.ct.create_string_buffer(alg_name.encode())) != oqs.OQS_SUCCESS:
+        raise RuntimeError('Can not switch algorithm')
+
+
+def randombytes_nist_kat_init(entropy_input, personalization_string=None):
+    """
+    Initializes the NIST DRBG with the an entropy seed.
+
+    :param entropy_input: entropy input seed, must be exactly 48 bytes long.
+    :param personalization_string: optional personalization string, which, if present, must be at least 48 bytes long.
+    """
+    if len(entropy_input) != 48:
+        raise ValueError('The entropy source must be exactly 48 bytes long')
+
+    if personalization_string is not None:
+        if len(personalization_string) < 48:
+            raise ValueError('The personalization string must be either empty or at least 48 bytes long')
+        oqs.liboqs.OQS_randombytes_nist_kat_init(oqs.ct.create_string_buffer(entropy_input),
+                                                 oqs.ct.create_string_buffer(personalization_string), 256)
+
+    oqs.liboqs.OQS_randombytes_nist_kat_init(oqs.ct.create_string_buffer(entropy_input), 0, 256)
+
+
+# TODO implement it
+def randombytes_in_place(random_array, bytes_to_read):
comment.body: @dstebila I'll remove it, it was supposed to generate random bytes directly into some buffer (similar to passing a pointer to C and filling the pre-allocated buffer). But won't keep this in Python.

+"""

+The liboqs project provides post-quantum public key cryptography algorithms:

+    Initializes the NIST DRBG with the an entropy seed.
+
+    :param entropy_input: entropy input seed, must be exactly 48 bytes long.
+    :param personalization_string: optional personalization string, which, if present, must be at least 48 bytes long.
+    """
+    if len(entropy_input) != 48:
+        raise ValueError('The entropy source must be exactly 48 bytes long')
+
+    if personalization_string is not None:
+        if len(personalization_string) < 48:
+            raise ValueError('The personalization string must be either empty or at least 48 bytes long')
+        oqs.liboqs.OQS_randombytes_nist_kat_init(oqs.ct.create_string_buffer(entropy_input),
+                                                 oqs.ct.create_string_buffer(personalization_string), 256)
+
+    oqs.liboqs.OQS_randombytes_nist_kat_init(oqs.ct.create_string_buffer(entropy_input), 0, 256)
+
+
+# TODO implement it
+def randombytes_in_place(random_array, bytes_to_read):
+    raise NotImplementedError
+
+
+# TODO implement it
+def randombytes_custom_algorithm(fun):

pull_request.title: Moved OQS KEX definitions to the crypto layer
pull_request.body:
Moved OQS KEX definitions from the ssl layer to the crypto layer. OpenSSL's internal NIDs are now automatically generated through the build system (defined in `crypto/objects/objects.txt` and generate by `make generate_crypto_objects`) and are distinct from the TLS curve/group IDs (still defined by our own code in the ssl layer, because we define special code points for these "curves").

These changes should allow 3rd party applications (such as OpenVPN) to use the oqs algs when looking them up by NID.
`
This is a draft request:
- Some new code needs to be integrated with templating framework

repo.description: Fork of OpenSSL that includes quantum-resistant algorithms and ciphersuites based on liboqs.
